metadata.Title: CVE-2021-21703 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description: In PHP versions 7.3.x up to and including 7.3.31, 7.4.x below 7.4.25 and 8.0.x below 8.0.12, when running PHP FPM SAPI with main FPM daemon process running as root and child worker processes running as lower-privileged users, it is possible for the child processes to access memory shared with the main process and write to it, modifying it in a way that would cause the root process to conduct invalid memory reads and writes, which can be used to escalate privileges from local unprivileged user to the root user.

notes.Note: sbeattie> PEAR issues should go against php-pear as of xenial

criterions.comment: php7.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
